item.description: The resurrection what does it mean and why does it matter?

item.description: Soaking is the key to intimacy with God, we need to slow down so God can draw close to us.

item.description: A divine encounter will bring change to our lives.

item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: How did I get into this mess, and what is it going to take for God to get my attention.

item.title: Facing my faults.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Forget the former things do not dwell on the past

item.title: We all need to have hope.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: May the God of hope fill you with joy and peace as you trust in him so that you may over flow with hope.

item.title: Principles to live by for 2009.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: God wants us to teach the transgressors our ways.

item.title: The power of forgiveness.
item.itunes:author: Pastor Kevin Phillips
item.description: Forgiveness is evangelism; we need to offer forgiveness to others.

item.title: What is your dream?
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Where there is no vision the people will parish, we need to dream big for our church and our lives.

item.title: Experiencing the Overflow
item.itunes:author: Pastor Kevin Phillips
item.description: Eliminating the 7 obstacles to God-given prosperity.

item.title: Restore the joy in me.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Have you lost your joy and do you need God to restore the joy of your salvation.

item.title: Create in me a pure heart.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We need to renew a steadfast spirit within us so that we dont lose the touch of God in our life.

item.title: Breaking Down the Barriers
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Breaking down the barriers and overcoming the lies that hold us back.

item.title: A new START for 2009
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Stop making excuses, take stock in what we have, act in faith, refocus our thoughts, Trust God.

item.title: The Life of Mary
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: The life of Mary and the birth of Christ. What she went through being a young teenager and raising a small child.

item.title: Keeping the Joy
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: What has happened to all of your Joy, without Joy in our life we will never be a strong Christian.

item.title: I am willing
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: One touch can make a difference, get a touch form Jesus.

item.itunes:author: Evangelist Joe Jackson
item.description: Joe Jackson speaks on bitterness and how you need to release it to God.

item.title: Joe speaks on bitterness.
item.itunes:author: Evangelist Joe Jackson
item.description: Joe Jackson speaks on bitterness and how you need to release it to God.

item.title: Overcoming the fear of failure.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Is the fear of failure creating excessive stress in your life.

item.title: Enjoying the life God meant us to live, Part 2.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We were created to experience an authentic relationship with other people.

item.title: Enjoying the life God meant us to live.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: People should enjoy every day of their life no matter how long you live.

item.title: The Greatest Congregation
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Congregation appreciations Sunday.

item.title: Why is the road of grace wide?
item.itunes:author: Evangelist Rick Pasquale
item.description: Rick Pasquale talked about the underground church in China and his message focused on the Grace of God.

item.title: What do you have?
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Whatever you give is acceptable if you give it eagerly. And give according to what you have not what you dont have.

item.title: Famine in the land.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Have you made trouble for everyone and abandoned the Lords commands. Is there green wood in your life and is your flesh nature still alive.

item.title: Putting the word into our heart.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: What God wants for us in when we read his word is to deposit it into our heart.

item.title: When God puts his finger on you.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: What happens in our life when God puts his finger on us, God likes to put his finger on our sore spot.

item.title: Spectacle or Spectator
item.itunes:author: Pastor Kevin Phillips
item.description: Do not be afraid to step in the water in front of everyone.

item.title: God who comforts us in our time of trials.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Hardships in life are there so we can get through them, and then we can help other people.

item.title: Stretching our Imagination
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Getting rid of doubt, holding on to the promises of God, finding some support.

item.title: How God Tests Our Faith
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Each one of us have been given a measure of faith, however God wants to grow our faith. In this teaching learn how God actually grows our faith.

item.title: Renew, Restore, and Refresh
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We live in a difficult time when many people have lost hope, given up on their dreams, and are just worn out. The Lord said that He can and will renew our spirit, restore what we have lost, and will refresh us if we allow Him to.

item.title: Little Is Much
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: When you allow the Lord to touch what you have, He gives an incredible increase.

item.title: The Grace of God for all men.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Say no to Ungodliness and worldly passion.

item.title: Learn to be sensitive to the Holy Spirit.
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Learn to be sensitive to the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Living by the spirit of God
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: If you are living by the spirit you will not gratify the sinful nature of the world.

item.title: Let It Die
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Let It Die.

item.title: Are you Discouraged or Frustrated?
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: What do you do when you feal like giving up?

item.title: Lord I feel overwhelmed!
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: At times in your life when you feel overwhelmed, God has something in store for your life.

item.title: What is it that you really want?
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description:
We live in a society that has so much at their fingertips, that many time we overlook the most important
things in life. Jesus ask's the question, what is it you need me to do for you? Today we want to address the question.

item.title: The Passion Killers of Life- Part 2
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Continuing his series, Pastor Haarer discusses more passion killers we face in every day life. Is your life God-centered enough to withstand the cares, stresses, and distractions of life? We must strive to live with a faith and passion that is greater than our surroundings or circumstances.

item.title: The Passion Killers of Life- Part 1
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Last week, Pastor Haarer shared on reigniting your passion. This week, Pastor begins a series on the Passion Killers of Life. We should change the way we live to embrace what draws us near to God and remove the roadblocks and passion-killers from our lives.

item.title: Reignite Your Passion for God
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: In Mark 11:30, we are told to love the Lord will all our hearts. Are you still passionate about God? In a distracting world that fights against godliness and holiness, its easy to become dispassionate. In those times, we must focus are refreshing our hearts and minds in Christ, reigniting our passion for God.

item.title: The Worlds Greatest Triumph
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We love stories about great victories. Take your average movie. With a few exceptions, most movies end with a triumphant hero and a defeated villan. We look up to people who have faced the world and conquered it, reading their biographies, following their advice, and emulating their behavior. But the greatest truimph of all occurred 2000 years ago when one man dared to die for the rest of the world. Jesus Christ, God made flesh, won a victory that he shares with those who dare believe.

item.title: Easter Sunrise Service
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rick Jordan
item.description: We were blessed to have Pastor Rick share during the Easter Sunrise Service. He preached about the meaning of Easter to the world, and our call to carry the true message of Jesus to them.

item.title: Who Is This Jesus
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Today, on Palm Sunday, Pastor Haarer seeks to answer a question many people think they know, but few really understand: who is this Jesus? The question that many asked as he walked the earth is still important today. For those who discover who Jesus really is, their lives will be forever transformed.

item.title: Prophetic Directions for 2008
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Pastor Haarer made faith declarations concerning our church today. God has predestined us for great things, and we must take hold of that to which Christ has called us.

item.title: Dream Church- Part 3
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Pastor Haarer concludes his three-part Dream Church series today. If we can dream it and believe it, we can have it. We can be that Dream Church.

item.title: Dream Church- Part 2
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: If we can partner together and join our faith, believing God for big things, there is no limit to what He will do. Pastor Haarer continues his Dream Church series.

item.title: Dream Church- Part 1
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: As he continues to share about vision, Pastor Haarer tells us that, if we can see it and believe it, we can have it. Nothing is impossible with God.

item.title: The Call to Love
item.itunes:author: Rev. Kevin J. Phillips
item.description: On the Sunday before Valentines Day, Pastor Kevin shares on the importance of living a life marked with love.

item.title: Where There is No Vision
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: As we prepare for God to do great things in our church and in our lives, Pastor Haarer shares for the second week in a row on the necessity of having a God-given vision.

item.title: I Have a Dream
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: The Bible says that, where there is no vision, the people perish. To be a living, active church, we must be a church with a dream. In honor of Martin Luther King Jr., Pastor Haarer shares on: I Have a Dream.

item.title: Moving into a New Season
item.itunes:author: Evangelist Michelle Haarer
item.description: We all experience great changes as we go through life. We were blessed and honored today to have Evangelist Michelle Haarer minister God's Word to us with passion. She shared with us on moving into a new season.

item.title: Where Does the Fire Fall
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Preachers teach about the fire of God. Worship leaders sing songs about it. And, yes, throughout scripture it is referenced. But how do we experience the fire of God, and how does it change our lives? Studying the story of Elijah on Mount Carmel, Pastor Haarer teaches us the power and meaning of the fire of God.

item.title: Nothing is Too Hard for God
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Today, Pastor Haarer introduced our theme for 2008: nothing is too hard for God. This year, let's exercise our faith in God and believe Him for the miraculous as we remind ourselves that there is nothing too difficult for Him to do.

item.title: Making the Most Out of Your New Year
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: At the beginning of every year, people quickly make resolutions, and just as quickly break them. How can we make the most out of the new year? By every day resolving to fulfill the purpose God has given us. We are called to redeem the times and make a difference with our actions in the Kingdom of God. Let's make the most out of 2008.

item.title: The Purpose of Christmas
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: On this Sunday before Christmas, Pastor Haarer discusses the purpose of Christmas and the importance of celebrating Christmas as the people of God.

item.title: What Christmas is All About
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: As Christmas approaches, we think about what it all means. Some people think its about family while others find it to be a commercial holiday. For Christians, it is a special time to remember the Savior of the world first coming to this Earth. As we come into this season, we remember that Jesus came to seek and to save what was lost. Christmas is about bringing healing to hurting people.

item.title: Give Thanks in All Things
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: As Thanksgiving day approaches, let's choose to remember that every good and perfect gift is from above. God is responsible for every good thing we have, and no matter what our circumstance, we have reason to give thanks to Him.

item.title: We Need God in America
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: As we celebrate our veterans on Veteran's Day Weekend, we remember the veteran of our souls, Jesus Christ who sacrificed himself for us. We also remember the great need we have for God in America.

item.title: When Our Past Becomes a Roadblock
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We are forgiven by God, but what happens when we can't forgive ourselves? As Christians, we must focus on moving forward, forgetting the past that Jesus has already forgiven. We can't let our past become a roadblock to God's plan for our lives.

item.title: Breaking Free From Temptation Part 2
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: When trying to defeat sin, it is important we learn how to deal with the temptations that come against us every day. Pastor Haarer continues and concludes his two part series on how to win over temptation in this message.

item.title: Breaking Free From Temptation Part 1
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Sin is a difficult thing. You think you have defeated a problem, only to have it rush back in on you. In this two-part series, Pastor Haarer discusses how to win over persistant temptation.

item.title: The I Problem
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: It has been said that we have met the enemy, and the enemy is us. Nothing could be more true when it comes to the problem of pride. We cause ourselves more hurt, pain, and stress while failing to show God's love to others when we act in pride. We need to address this I problem. As the Bible says, let he who boasts boast about the Lord.

item.title: Dare to Be a Risk Taker
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Churches and Christians are in one of three categories: risktaking, where you step out in faith, caretaking, where to focus in on maintenance rather than growth, and undertaking, where we allow the things God has planted to die. Pastor Haarer challenges us to step out in faith and be risk takers.

item.title: Handling Harassment for Your Faith
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: The good news about Jesus seems foolish to those in the world that think they are wise, and is a stumbling block for those who wish to live a sinful lifestyle. It is no surprise then that people will often harass Christians for what they believe and mock their faith. In the popular words of Jesus known as the beatitudes, we are instructed how to deal with persecution.

item.title: Finding Your Missing Peace
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Jesus said, 'Blessed are the peace-makers.' In a time of international warfare, political division, and decadence that ruins so many lives, peace is in short supply. In his message, Pastor Haarer brings to light how to find and maintain peace in a turbulent world.

item.title: Happy Are the Pure in Heart
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Looking at Jesus' famous speech, the Sermon on the Mount, we read Jesus' words: "Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God." Pastor Haarer examines the importance of a pure heart in the life of a Christian.

item.title: You Get What You Give
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: God provided great mercy to us through Jesus Christ. But are we showing that same mercy to others? Are we forgiving? Do we show kindness to those who have not been kind to us? Do we really demonstrate undeserved mercy to others? Pastor Haarer reminds us that you get what you give.

item.title: When Life Short-circuits
item.itunes:author: Rev. Kevin J. Phillips
item.description: Have you ever had one of those weeks where everything goes wrong? As Christians, we can't let circumstances determine our conduct. Pastor Kevin shares four keys to standing strong when life short-circuits.

item.title: The Secret of Satisfaction
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We are blessed in our country. Many of the needy in our society would be considered well off in the third world. We have more toys, money, and posessions than the rest of the world. And yet, so many in our country are not satisfied. They aren't happy with thier possesions, their situations, their standing in life. In this message, we learn the secret to satisfaction.

item.title: Controlling My Reactions
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: When we don't learn to control how we react to our circumstances, then our circumstances control us. Christians must learn to deny the sinful nature and react to life in a godly and purposeful way.

item.title: How to Heal a Broken Heart
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: This world is full of broken-hearted people. Even Christians go around with a smile on their face, and yet they feel like they are dying inside. But Jesus Christ came to heal the broken-hearted. You can experience his healing.

item.title: Don't Worry Be Happy
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: The Bible says that 'man is born to trouble, as surely as sparks fly upward.' And while this is true for everyone, Christians have a promise from God that helps them through life's troubles: 'cast all your cares upon Him, for He cares for you.' Jesus walks with us and helps us through the hard times. Instead of worrying, which accomplishes nothing, we can learn to act with wisdom and, ulitmately, learn to be content whatever our temporary earthly circumstances.

item.title: Wake Up
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: As time is short and the end is near, we cannot afford to be a sleeping church. We must wake up, hear God, live purposefully, and act as the body of Christ.

item.title: Let Freedom Reign
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We are blessed to enjoy the freedoms we have in the United States of America. Likewise, we are also blessed to enjoy our freedom in Christ. We must stay free from the bondage of sin and doubt, walking in the liberty given to us through Christ.

item.title: I See the Lord
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: When Isaiah had a vision of the Lord, what he saw changed his life and outlook forever. As Christians, we too must gain a vision of who Jesus really is; a clear understanding of who He is will transform and empower the Christian.

item.title: The Love of the Father
item.itunes:author: Pastor Kevin Phillips
item.description: As we honor our fathers on Father's Day, our Heavenly Father is truly worthy of all the glory, honor, and praise. He has loved us with an everlasting love.

item.title: Accept No Substitute
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: The world offers many false alternatives to the truth. But there is not alternative to the truth found in the Word of God. The church can accept no substitute.

item.title: The Shortages of Life
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Have you experienced a shortage in life? We all have, be it money, ability, knowledge, wisdom, or opportunity. As Christians, we must learn to depend on God for provision, strength, and direction. We may experience shortages in life, but we have a God who supplies all our needs.

item.title: There is Life After Giving Up
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: It is hard to let go of your dreams. But when God closes a door, he always opens a new one. It's not over. There is life after giving up.

item.title: Pleased But Not Satisfied
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Satisfaction can be the enemy of the Christian. While we should be content with what God has given us, we should never be satisfied with where we are. We must always dream bigger. Seek to do something greater. Strive to be all we can be for the Kingdom of God. We must be pleased, but not satisfied.

item.title: God's Remedy to Damaged Emotions
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Life can be very hurtful. But the principles found in the Word of God demonstrate how to find healing in the midst of life's troubles. Pastor Haarer shares from the scriptures about God's remedy to damaged emotions.

item.title: Heart to Heart
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: As Paul poured out his heart to Timothy, he challenged him to stir up the gift of God. Pastor Haarer challenges us to do the same in these last days.

item.title: Acquire the Fire
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Our youth group came back from Acquire the Fire with a new passion for God. Hear Pastor Haarer's challenge to the church to acquire the fire and embrace God's transforming power.

item.title: The Meaning of Easter
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Easter comes and goes, and for many it is one of the two times they go to church in a year. Instead of making it a religious practice, you should ask yourself- what is the meaning of Easter, and how should it affect me?

item.title: At the Foot of the Cross
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: You stand at the foot of the cross every day in a very real, spiritual sense. As we look at what took place there when Jesus was crucified, we realize the decision that faces all of mankind.

item.title: How to Hear God's Voice
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: In a world full of voices, we remain short on truth. If we want to live purposefully and wisely, we must be people who hear the voice of our Creator.

item.title: How to Profit From Your Problems
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: You can't avoid it. Life is full of problems. How do you repond when trials come your way? Be smart. Learn to profit from your problems.

item.title: The Power of One
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: One person can make a difference. One person can change eternity for a lost soul. You have the power, through God, to do great things.

item.title: Why We Fail to Succeed
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: God wants to bless us and make our paths successful, but we must live according to the principles found in the word of God. Pastor Haarer examines biblical reasons we fail to succeed.

item.title: Power From On High
item.itunes:author: Rev. Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: The baptism in the Holy Spirit is a scripturally promised empowerment from God that is available to every Christian. Just as the disciples were filled with the Spirit on the day of Pentecost, we too can recieve what God has promised.

item.title: An Unashamed Church
item.itunes:author: Pastor Kevin Phillips
item.description: We need to be a church that is unashamed of who and what God has called us to be. In this message, Pastor Kevin discusses 5 lies the world tells us to keep the church from proclaiming the truth.

item.title: Taking Wise Risks- Part 2
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Life is about taking risks. We must step out in faith if we are going to make things happen and take chances to fulfill our dreams. In Part 2 of this message, we learn six keys to taking wise risks.

item.title: Taking Wise Risks- Part 1
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Life is about taking risks. We must step out in faith if we are going to make things happen and take chances to fulfill our dreams. But there is a right way to take risks. We must act according to godly principles and make wise decisions.

item.title: Make It Happen
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We can wait an eternity for our hopes and dreams to come true, or we can make it happen. Have faith in God, step out and live your dream, and all things are possible through God. Live your destiny. You can make it happen!

item.title: Eternal Investments
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: God promises to supply all our needs. But there is a premise to the promise... the way we give determines how God blesses us. We must make eternal investments into the Kingdom of God if we want to enjoy the blessings and favor of God.

item.title: A Season for Change
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: To move ahead in the things of God, you must be willing the change.

item.title: Are You a Casualty?
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Are you guilty of casual living? If you don't live your life with purpose, you will end a casualty in the Kingdom of God.

item.title: Pastor Bobby Jones
item.itunes:author: Pastor Bobby Jones
item.description: Pastor Bobby Jones preached a powerful message while Pastor Haarer was gone on vacation.

item.title: Giving Thanks in Tough Times
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We must always be thankful for what God has given us and how He has blessed us, especially when we face hardship, trials, and temptation.

item.title: Giving Thanks
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We ought to be thankful, not just during the holidays or on Thanksgiving, but every day of our lives.

item.title: Veteran's Day Message
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: This Veteran's Day message was a challenge to everyone, as Americans and as followers of Christ.

item.title: Serving God with Passion
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Serving God should be done with passion and commitment.

item.title: What Makes a Hero
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Take on God's call to be a hero to the lost and broken.

item.title: It's High Time
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Time is short, and the church needs to take care of the Father's business.

item.title: Successful or Defeated
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: We choose to be defeated or to be overcomers.

item.title: I Hear a Sound
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: In these last days, the Holy Spirit is moving in powerful ways.

item.title: God's Antidote to Indecision
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: The Word of God gives us clear instructions on how to make wise, godly decisions.

item.title: A Right Perception
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: Your perception determines your outcome.

item.title: Shelter in the Time of Storm
item.itunes:author: Pastor Dennis L. Haarer
item.description: God gives us hope and shelter thru life's storms.
